main_definition: Bearing refers to the attitude, demeanor, or way in which a person carries themselves or presents their thoughts or opinions.

meanings_and_examples.definition: The manner in which someone behaves or conducts themselves
meanings_and_examples.example: Despite facing many challenges, she maintained a calm and composed bearing.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A fixed point used for reference, often indicating position or direction
meanings_and_examples.example: The compass indicated that we were heading due north from our current bearing.

meanings_and_examples.definition: The way in which a situation is carried out or dealt with
meanings_and_examples.example: His approach to resolving conflicts at work demonstrated his pragmatic bearing.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A measure of the distance between two points on a circular path, expressed as an angle in degrees from north or south
meanings_and_examples.example: The bearing of our ship changed by 45 degrees to avoid the storm ahead.
